quotes.quote: As long as there was coffee in the world, how bad could things be?
Some of the world's most effective thoughts happen over a brew of morning's coffee
Way too much coffee. But if it weren't for the coffee, I'd have no identifiable personality whatsoever.
I would rather suffer from coffee than be senseless.
Coffee is a language in itself
I was taken by the power that savoring a simple cup of coffee can have to connect people and create community.
People don't stop eating, and they don't stop drinking coffee.
When traveling with someone, take large dose of patience and tolerance with your morning coffee.
Behind every successful woman is a substantial amount of coffee.
He was my cream, and I was his coffee â€“ And when you poured us together, it was something.
Adventure in life is good; consistency in coffee even better.
It's amazing how the world begins to change through the eyes of a cup of coffee.
The powers of a man's mind are directly proportioned to the quantity of coffee he drinks.
If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
I could smell myself awake with that coffee.
Coffee first. Schemes later.
The second cup of coffee is never as good as the first.
Once you wake up and smell the coffee, it's hard to go back to sleep.
I had some dreams, they were clouds in my coffee.
I can't imagine a day without coffee. I can't imagine!
The morning cup of coffee has an exhilaration about it which the cheering influence of the afternoon or evening cup of tea cannot be expected to reproduce.
Coffee is a language in itself.
Coffee is good for talent, but genius wants prayer.
Coffee, the favorite drink of the civilized world.
If I asked for a cup of coffee, someone would search for the double meaning.
Our culture runs on coffee and gasoline, the first often tasting like the second.
Coffee is a way of stealing time that should by rights belong to your older self.
Good communication is just as stimulating as black coffee, and just as hard to sleep after.
Coffee is the common man's gold, and like gold, it brings to every person the feeling of luxury and nobility.
Black coffee must be strong and very hot; if strong coffee does not agree with you, do not drink black coffee. And if you do not drink black coffee, do not drink any coffee at all.
Coffee was a food in that house, not a drink.
A morning coffee is my favorite way of starting the day, settling the nerves so that they don't later fray.
No coffee can be good in the mouth that does not first send a sweet offering of odor to the nostrils.
Coffee in England always tastes like a chemistry experiment.
I like coffee because it gives me the illusion that I might be awake.
I orchestrate my mornings to the tune of coffee.
The coffee was so strong it snarled as it lurched out of the pot.
Without my morning coffee, I'm just like a dried-up piece of goat.
Coffee is a beverage that puts one to sleep when not drank.
Even bad coffee is better than no coffee at all.
I never laugh until I've had my coffee.
I think if I were a woman I'd wear coffee as a perfume.
Science may never come up with a better office communication system than the coffee break.
No matter what historians claimed, BC really stood for Before Coffee.
I don't see the point in caffeine without coffee. Or coffee without caffeine, for that matter.
Given enough coffee I could rule the world.
There's nothing sweeter than a cup of bitter coffee.
It turned out people truly did cry into their coffee cups.

The coffee is prepared in such a way that it makes those who drink it witty: at least there is not a single soul who, on quitting the house, does not believe himself four times wittier that when he entered it.
Coffee makes us severe, and grave, and philosophical.
What goes best with a cup of coffee? Another cup.
I put instant coffee in a microwave oven and almost went back in time.
A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems.
Do you know how helpless you feel if you have a full cup of coffee in your hand and you start to sneeze?
Caffeine and sugar, the two basic food groups.
It is inhumane, in my opinion, to force people who have a genuine medical need for coffee to wait in line behind people who apparently view it as some kind of recreational activity.
Chocolate and coffee? Together? Whoever came up with that combination should have won a Nobel Peace Prize. Or at least a subscription to Reader's Digest.
I poured a compass into my coffee, to give the flavor some direction.
Free yourself from the slavery of tea and coffee and other slop kettles!
If your eyes hurt after you drink coffee, you have to take the spoon out of the cup.
I believe humans get a lot done, not because we're smart, but because we have thumbs so we can make coffee.
I've taken up meditation. I like to have an espresso first to make it more challenging.
Coffee has two virtues: it is wet and warm.
When I wake up in the morning, I just can't get started until I've had that first, piping hot pot of coffee. Oh, I've tried other enemas...
I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.
Decaffeinated coffee is kind of like kissing your sister.
It must be slow, for I have been drinking it for sixty-five years and I am not yet dead.
Coffee: creative lighter fluid.
Never drink black coffee at lunch; it will keep you awake in the afternoon.
These angry zombies were rushing to work, and their eyes flashed fair warning: Don't mess with us. We haven't had our coffee.
Coffee in England is just toasted milk.
No matter how much strong coffee we drink, almost any after dinner speech will counteract it.
I judge a restaurant by the bread and by the coffee.
Why do they always put mud into coffee on board steamers? Why does the tea generally taste of boiled boots?
There isn't enough coffee in the United States to keep everyone awake during a Presidential election campaign.

There are various theories as to what characteristics, what combination of traits, what qualities in our men won [World War II]… but, speaking from my own observation of our armed forces, I should say the war was won on coffee.

Making coffee has become the great compromise of the decade. It's the only thing "real" men do that doesn't seem to threaten their masculinity. To women, it's on the same domestic entry level as putting the spring back into the toilet-tissue holder or taking a chicken out of the freezer to thaw.
Almost all my middle-aged and elderly acquaintances, including me, feel about 25, unless we haven't had our coffee, in which case we feel 107.
I began wearing hats as a  young lawyer because it helped me to establish my professional identity. Before that, whenever I was at a meeting, someone would ask me to get coffee.
Coffee, (which makes the politician wise, / And see thro' all things with his half-shut eyes).
What would life be without coffee? But then, what is it even with coffee?
They said I could be anything, so I decided to be caffeinated!
